channel.title: Warm Day
channel.description:
Not sure where else to put this.
Shot some video around the house and edited it together.
Enjoy!
http://www.vimeo.com/2644164
Make sure HD is on, click fullscreen, and turn off scaling to view at the correct proportions.
I'll have it up on YouTube by the end of the day as well.
UPDATE: Actually, YouTube's HD isn't all that bad. The compression looks like it's beating out vimeo's. Watch it here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFzhxk-W32w&fmt=22

item.title: Warm Day
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

exps35:

Not gonna lie, I’m jealous of that camera.

[quote=“davidude36, post:4, topic:253131”]^^, very good quality video though.

Make them turn in to skittles or something[/quote]

I want one

Read full topic

item.title: Warm Day
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:253131”][quote author=exps35 link=topic=334416.msg2603763#msg2603763 date=1230415409]
Not gonna lie, I’m jealous of that camera.
[/quote]

Dude if you would see some footage straight from it, orgasmic.

Vimeo adds a heavy amount of artifacts actually. The original 1080 footage was so nice and sharp and clean.

It’s amazing this 600$ camera has (when nicely lit) footage that rivals some 3k$ cameras. (well. excluding the Scarlet)

Lawl. It’s not meant to be a story or anything. Just some shots around the house of some pets.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 27, 2008, 06:21:55 pm[/size][hr]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFzhxk-W32w&fmt=22

Up on YouTube. It’s low quality I don’t know why. Either normal users can’t upload HD or it takes longer for that to show up.

Who knows.[/quote]
It is HD


I just waited a few seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Warm Day
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:253131”][quote author=exps35 link=topic=334416.msg2603763#msg2603763 date=1230415409]
Not gonna lie, I’m jealous of that camera.
[/quote]

Dude if you would see some footage straight from it, orgasmic.

Vimeo adds a heavy amount of artifacts actually. The original 1080 footage was so nice and sharp and clean.

It’s amazing this 600$ camera has (when nicely lit) footage that rivals some 3k$ cameras. (well. excluding the Scarlet)[/quote]

A few years ago I bought a digital video camera for 600 dollars. The quality is crap and the camera is massive. My crap cellphone can take similar quality, just shittier resolution.

I really wish I’d have waited a little bit to buy one. Mine is useless now.

By the way is that dog part lhasa apso? Looks like mine. Nice birds too. My birds are all dead now lol.

Read full topic
